channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2377] A boss in information security forgot to lock his computer..
item.description: ....and this is what his staff had waiting for him.

item.title: [+2046] What Your Opposition to Gay Marriage Really Means (Graphic)
item.description: Close-minded folks will have to brew up a new batch of excuses after the emergence of this graphic.

item.title: [+1294] What Happens When You Slow Down a Justin Bieber Song by 800%
item.description: Justin Bieber is very popular. Lots of people love her songs! One of Bieber's most popular tunes is called "You Smile." But what happens when one slows it down by 800%? Well, it becomes a haunting, 36-minute Enya-like thingy. Seriously

item.title: [+1283] I love my childhood
[+1227] Your fears confirmed: 'up to' broadband speeds are bogus
item.description: The FCC crunches the numbers and reveals a dirty secret: real broadband speeds and "up to" broadband speeds aren't even close. Most Americans get half the "up to" speed they purchased.

item.title: [+963] Dear Walt Disney (PICS)
item.description: What a sweet little girl. I'm glad her message got to the right person. This chain of letters will certainly make you smile.

item.title: [+930] xkcd: Ahead Stop
[+757] BBC Weatherman Finger Fail
item.description: Poor Tomasz Schafernaker reacts to a bit of goading from Simon McCoy, only for the vision mixer to throw to him at the wrong moment. Priceless.

item.title: [+747] Geek Poetry (PIC)
item.description: When geeks take to the streets, this is what you get.

item.title: [+660] Facebook Partnership Is Proven by $3,000 Check, Lawyer Says
item.description: The western New York man suing over claims he owns 84 percent of Facebook Inc. has a copy of a $3,000 cashier's check that may support his contract claim against the company and Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg.

item.title: [+593] US Soldiers Suicides Vs KIA (Stats)
[+561] The History of Digg (Infographic )
item.description: A hot girlfriend and a house or a geeky programmer and a social news site ? That's an easy one for many of us however the same can't hold true for Digg founder Kevin Rose. This infograhpic gives us a rundown on the history of Digg.com .

item.title: [+559] 8 of the Dirtiest Sexual Innuendos in Children's Cartoons
item.description: As children, we spent many Saturday mornings watching our favorite cartoons on the tube. These days, we may re-watch the same cartoons we watched a decade (or even two decades) ago and find some utterly horrifying-yet-hilarious sexual innuendos sprinkled throughout them.

item.title: [+557] After a workout with this trainer, you're gonna need a bath
item.description: ... but you'll never be able to scrub away the memories.

item.title: [+491] Study -- Girls Like Giving (and Getting) Oral Sex
item.description: University of Alberta researcher Brea Malacad studied 181 women ages 18 to 25 about their past and current heterosexual experiences, attitudes and opinions and found that 50 percent viewed oral sex as a less intimate activity than intercourse and over 30 percent felt powerful when performing fellatio.

item.title: [+482] Body Counts for ‘The Expendables’ Cast (Infographic)
item.description: If you think the cast of ‘The Expendables’ killed a lot of bad guys in that movie, you haven’t seen anything yet – check out their combined ‘kill numbers’ based on all their movies.

item.title: [+480] The Top 10 Right-Wing Conspiracy Theories
item.description: Conspiracy theorizing has flourished as a virtual art form in all nations and across all political persuasions. But the American radical right has to be considered a strong contender for the title of modern conspiracy champion. A vast body of academic literature exists exploring this history...

item.title: [+479] Dinner Choices (PIC)
[+479] What Your Gamertag Says About You [Chart]
item.description: Your gamertag is your online identity, which of course is more important than your actual identity since you probably meet way more people online than you do on your rare visits outside.

item.title: [+468] "F**k Me, Ray Bradbury" is the year's best scifi pop song
item.description: This sweetly horny tribute to the work of Ray Bradbury, starring Rachel Bloom as the girl who wants to fuck "the greatest scifi writer in history," is sure to put a smile on your face. [may be NSFW]
